content.question: The figure above represents a square sheet of cardboard with side length 20 inches. The sheet is cut and pieces are discarded. When the cardboard is folded, it becomes a rectangular box with a lid. The pattern for the rectangular box with a lid is shaded in the figure. Four squares with side length <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and two rectangular regions are discarded from the cardboard. Which of the following statements is true? (The volume <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of a rectangular box is given by <math alttext="v equals, l w h" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>l</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.)

choices.label: When <math alttext="x equals 10" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></math> inches, the box has a minimum possible volume.
When <math alttext="x equals 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> inches, the box has a maximum possible volume.

When <math alttext="x equals, the fraction 10 over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> inches, the box has a minimum possible volume.

When <math alttext="x equals, the fraction 10 over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> inches, the box has a maximum possible volume.
